arabicText: ۞ وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ لِقَآءَنَا لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ أَوْ نَرَىٰ رَبَّنَا ۗ لَقَدِ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ فِىٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَعَتَوْ عُتُوًّۭا كَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	do	not	expect	to	meet	Us	
said,	“Why	were	the	angels	not	sent	down	
to	us	or	we	been	able	to	see	our	Lord?”	
Indeed	they	thought	too	highly	of	
themselves	and	they	turned	extremely	
rebellious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	woh	log	jo	hamāre	milne	ki	
ummid	nahiñ	rakhte	ham	par	Firishte	
kyuñ	na	utāre	yā	ham	apne	Rab	ko	dekhte	
be-shak	apni	jee	meiñ	bahut	hi	ooñchi	
kheeñchi	aur	badi	sarkashi	par	āaye

arabicText: يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ لَا بُشْرَىٰ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ لِّلْمُجْرِمِينَ وَيَقُولُونَ حِجْرًۭا مَّحْجُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	day	when	they	will	see	the	angels	-	
that	day	will	not	be	of	any	happiness	for	
the	guilty	-	and	they	will	cry,	“O	God,	erect	
a	barrier	between	us	and	them!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	Firishtoñ	ko	dekheñ	ge	woh	din	
mujrimoñ	ki	koi	khushi	kā	na	hogā	aur	
kaheñ	ge		ilāhi	ham	meiñ	un	meiñ	koi	āad	
karde	ruki	huyi

arabicText: وَقَدِمْنَآ إِلَىٰ مَا عَمِلُوا۟ مِنْ عَمَلٍۢ فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ هَبَآءًۭ مَّنثُورًا
englishTranslationText:
And	We	turned	all	the	deeds	they	had	
performed	into	scattered	floating	specks	
of	dust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	kuch	unhoñ	ne	kām	kiye	they	hamne	
Qasd	farmā	kar	unheiñ	bāreek	bāreek	
gubār	ke	bikhre	huye	zarre	kardiyā	ke	
rozan	ke	dhoop	meiñ	nazar	āate	haiñ

arabicText: أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَيْرٌۭ مُّسْتَقَرًّۭا وَأَحْسَنُ مَقِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	for	the	People	of	the	Garden	on	that	
day	is	a	better	destination	and	account,	
and	a	better	place	of	afternoon	rest.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jannat	wāloñ	kā	us	din	achcha	thikānā	aur	
hisāb	ke	dopeher	ke	b’ad	achchi	ārām	ki	
jagah

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ بِٱلْغَمَـٰمِ وَنُزِّلَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ تَنزِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
And	the	day	when	the	sky	will	be	split	
asunder	with	clouds	and	the	angels	will	be	
sent	down	in	full.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	din	phat	jayegā	āsmān	bādaloñ	se	
aur	Firishtey	utāre	jāyeñge	puri	tarah

arabicText: ٱلْمُلْكُ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْحَقُّ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۚ وَكَانَ يَوْمًا عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَسِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	true	kingship	on	that	day	belongs	to	
the	Most	Gracious;	and	that	is	hard	for	the	
disbelievers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	din	sachchi	bādshāhi	Rahmān	ki	hai	aur	
woh		din	kāfiroñ	par	sakht	hai

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ يَعَضُّ ٱلظَّالِمُ عَلَىٰ يَدَيْهِ يَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى ٱتَّخَذْتُ مَعَ ٱلرَّسُولِ سَبِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	the	day	when	the	unjust	will	gnaw	his	
hands,	saying,	“Alas,	if	only	I	had	chosen	a	
way	along	with	the	(Noble)	Messenger	(of	
Allah)!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	din	ƶalim	apne	hāth	chabā	chabā	
legā	ke	hāye	kisi	tarah	se	maiñ	ne	Rasool	
ke	sāth	rāh	li	hoti

arabicText: يَـٰوَيْلَتَىٰ لَيْتَنِى لَمْ أَتَّخِذْ فُلَانًا خَلِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“Woe	to	me	–	alas,	if	only	I	had	not	taken	
that	one	for	a	friend.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wāye	kharābi	meri	hāye	kisi	tarah	maiñ	ne	
fulāñ	ne	ko	dost	na	banāyā	hotā.

arabicText: لَّقَدْ أَضَلَّنِى عَنِ ٱلذِّكْرِ بَعْدَ إِذْ جَآءَنِى ۗ وَكَانَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ لِلْإِنسَـٰنِ خَذُولًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“He	indeed	led	me	astray	from	the	advice	that	had	come	to	me”;	and	Satan	deserts	man,	leaving	
him	unaided.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	usne	mujhe	bahkā	diyā	mere	pās	āayi	huyi		naseehat	se	aur	shaitān	ādmi	ko	be-madad	
chord	detā	hai

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلرَّسُولُ يَـٰرَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِى ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ مَهْجُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Noble	Messenger	submitted,	“O	my	Lord	-	indeed	my	people	took	this	Qur’an	as	worthy	
of	being	abandoned.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Rasool	ne	árz	ki	ke	aey	mere	Rab	meri	Qaom	ne	is	Qur’ān	ko	chordne	ke	qābil	thahrā	liyā

arabicText: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلْنَا لِكُلِّ نَبِىٍّ عَدُوًّۭا مِّنَ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ هَادِيًۭا وَنَصِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	this	is	how	We	had	appointed	guilty	people	as	enemies	to	every	Prophet;	and	Allah	is	
Sufficient,	to	guide	and	to	aid.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	isi	tarah	hamne	har	Nabi	ke	liye	dushman	bana	diye	they	mujrim	log	aur	tumhārā	Rab	kāfi	
hai	hidayāt	karne	aur	madad	dene	ko.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْقُرْءَانُ جُمْلَةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنُثَبِّتَ بِهِۦ فُؤَادَكَ ۖ وَرَتَّلْنَـٰهُ تَرْتِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	the	disbelievers	say,	“Why	was	the	Qur’an	not	sent	down	to	him	all	at	once?”	This	is	how	We	
sent	it	in	stages,	in	order	to	strengthen	your	heart	with	it	and	We	read	it	slowly,	in	stages.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kāfir	bole	Qur’ān	un	par	ek	sāth	kyuñ	na	utār	diyā	hamne	yuñ	hi	ba-tadreej	usey	utārā	hai	ke	
us	se	tumhārā	dil	mazboot	kare	aur	hamne	usey	thaher	thaher	kar	padhā

arabicText: وَلَا يَأْتُونَكَ بِمَثَلٍ إِلَّا جِئْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَحْسَنَ تَفْسِيرًا
englishTranslationText:
And	they	will	never	bring	you	an	example,	
but	We	shall	bring	you	a	true	narration	and	
better	than	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	koi	kahāwat	tumhāre	pās	na	
lāyeiñ	ge	magar	Ham	Haq	aur	isse	behtar	
bayān	le	āayeiñge	.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يُحْشَرُونَ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ شَرٌّۭ مَّكَانًۭا وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	will	be	dragged	on	their	faces	
towards	hell	–	theirs	is	the	worst	
destination	and	they	are	the	most	astray.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	Jahannam	ki	taraf	hāñke	
jāyeiñge	apne	muñh	ke	bal	unkā	thikānā	
sabse	burā	aur	woh		sabse	gumrāh

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَجَعَلْنَا مَعَهُۥٓ أَخَاهُ هَـٰرُونَ وَزِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	gave	Moosa	the	Book	and	
appointed	with	him	his	brother	Haroon	as	
a	deputy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hamne	Mūsā	ko	kitāb	'aṭa	
farmāyi	aur	iske	bhāi	Hāroon	ko	wazeer	
kiyā

arabicText: فَقُلْنَا ٱذْهَبَآ إِلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَدَمَّرْنَـٰهُمْ تَدْمِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
We	therefore	said,	“Go,	both	of	you,	to	the	
people	who	have	denied	Our	signs”;	then	
ruining	the	people,	We	destroyed	them	
completely.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Hamne	farmāyā	tum	dono	jāo	us	Qaom	
ki	taraf	jisne	hamāri	Āyateiñ	jhutlāiñ	phir	
hamne	unheiñ	tabāh	karke	halāk	kardiyā

arabicText: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍۢ لَّمَّا كَذَّبُوا۟ ٱلرُّسُلَ أَغْرَقْنَـٰهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ لِلنَّاسِ ءَايَةًۭ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	the	people	of	Nooh	-	when	they	denied	
the	Noble	Messengers,	We	drowned	them	
and	made	them	a	sign	for	mankind;	and	
We	have	kept	prepared	a	painful	
punishment	for	the	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Nūh	ki	Qaom	ko	jab	unhoñ	ne	
Rasooloñ	ko	jhutlāyā	hamne	unko	Dubo	
diyā	aur	unheiñ	logoñ	ke	liye	nishāni	
kardiyā	aur	hamne	zālimoñ	ke	liye	
dardnāk	áƶāb	tayyār	kar	rakhā	hai	.

arabicText: وَعَادًۭا وَثَمُودَا۟ وَأَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلرَّسِّ وَقُرُونًۢا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ كَثِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	the	tribes	of	A’ad	and	the	Thamud,	and	
the	people	of	the	Wells,	and	many	a	
generation	between	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	‘Āad	aur	Samood	aur	Kueiñ	wāloñ	ko	
aur	inke	beech	meiñ	bahut	si	sangateiñ

arabicText: وَكُلًّۭا ضَرَبْنَا لَهُ ٱلْأَمْثَـٰلَ ۖ وَكُلًّۭا تَبَّرْنَا تَتْبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	We	illustrated	examples	to	each	one	of	
them;	and	ruining	them,	annihilated	them	
all.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Hamne	sabse	misāleiñ	bayān	farmāyiñ	
aur	sabko	tabāh	karke	mitā	diyā

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَتَوْا۟ عَلَى ٱلْقَرْيَةِ ٱلَّتِىٓ أُمْطِرَتْ مَطَرَ ٱلسَّوْءِ ۚ أَفَلَمْ يَكُونُوا۟ يَرَوْنَهَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يَرْجُونَ نُشُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	they	have	visited	the	township	
upon	which	had	rained	a	harmful	rain;	so	were	they	not	seeing	it?	In	fact,	they	never	expected	to	
be	raised	again.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zaroor	yeh	ho	āye	haiñ	us	basti	par	
jispar	burā	barsāo	barsā	thā	to	yeh	kya	usey	dekhte	na	they	balke	unheiñ	jee	uthne	ki	ummeed	
thi	hi	nahiñ

arabicText: وَإِذَا رَأَوْكَ إِن يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى بَعَثَ ٱللَّهُ رَسُولًا
englishTranslationText:
And	when	they	see	you	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	they	take	
you	but	as	a	mockery,	“Is	this	the	one	whom	Allah	sent	as	a	(Noble)	Messenger?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	tumheiñ	dekhte	haiñ	to	tumheiñ	nahiñ	thahrāte	magar	tha-thāha	(Mazāq)	kyā	yeh	haiñ	
jinko	Allah	ne	Rasool	banā	kar	bhejā	hai

arabicText: إِن كَادَ لَيُضِلُّنَا عَنْ ءَالِهَتِنَا لَوْلَآ أَن صَبَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ حِينَ يَرَوْنَ ٱلْعَذَابَ مَنْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
“Possibly	he	would	have	misled	us	away	from	our	Gods	had	we	not	been	firm	upon	them”;	soon	
they	will	know,	when	they	see	the	punishment,	who	was	astray	from	the	path.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Qareeb	thā	ke	yeh	hame	hamāre	khudāoñ	se	behkā	deiñ	agar	ham	in	par	sabr	na	karte	aur	ab	jānā	
chāhte	haiñ	jis	din	áƶāb	dekheñge	ke	kaun	gumrāh	thā

arabicText: أَرَءَيْتَ مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَـٰهَهُۥ هَوَىٰهُ أَفَأَنتَ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ وَكِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	see	the	one	who	chose	his	own	desires	as	his	God?	So	will	you	accept	the	responsibility	
of	guarding	him?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	tumne	usey	dekhā	jisne	apni	jee	ki	khwāhish	ko	apnā	Khudā	banā	liyā	to	kyā	tum	uski	
nigehbāni	kā	zimma	loge?

arabicText: أَمْ تَحْسَبُ أَنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ يَسْمَعُونَ أَوْ يَعْقِلُونَ ۚ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا كَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ ۖ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
Or	do	you	think	that	most	of	them	hear	or	
understand	something?	They	are	not	but	
like	the	cattle	–	in	fact	more	astray	from	
the	path	than	them!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ya	yeh	samjhte	ho	ke	un	meiñ	bahut	kuchh	
sunte	ya	samjhte	haiñ	woh		to	nahiñ	magar	
jaise	chaupāye	balke	unse	bhi	badtar	
gumrāh

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيْفَ مَدَّ ٱلظِّلَّ وَلَوْ شَآءَ لَجَعَلَهُۥ سَاكِنًۭا ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا ٱلشَّمْسَ عَلَيْهِ دَلِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	dear	Prophet,	did	you	not	see	your	Lord,	
how	He	spread	the	shade?	And	if	He	willed,	
He	could	have	made	it	still;	then	We	made	
the	sun	a	proof	upon	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Mehboob	kyā	tum	ne	apne	Rab	ko	na	
dekhā	ke	kaisā	phailāyā	sāyā	aur	agar	
chāhtā	to	usey		thahrāyā	huā	kar	detā	phir	
hamne	sooraj	ko	uspar	daleel	kiyā	.

arabicText: ثُمَّ قَبَضْنَـٰهُ إِلَيْنَا قَبْضًۭا يَسِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText: We	then	gradually	withdraw	it	towards	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	Hamne	āahista	āahista	usey	apni	taraf	
sametā

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ لِبَاسًۭا وَٱلنَّوْمَ سُبَاتًۭا وَجَعَلَ ٱلنَّهَارَ نُشُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	made	the	night	a	veil	for	
you,	and	the	sleep	a	rest,	and	made	the	day	
for	getting	up.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	wohi	hai	jisne	rāt	ko	tumhāre	liye	
parda	kiyā	aur	neeñd	ko	āarām	aur	din	
banāyā	uthne	ke	liye

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَرْسَلَ ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ بُشْرًۢا بَيْنَ يَدَىْ رَحْمَتِهِۦ ۚ وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ طَهُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	sent	the	winds	giving	glad	
tidings	before	His	mercy;	and	We	sent	
down	purifying	water	from	the	sky.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	wohi	hai	jisne	hawāyeiñ	bheji	apni	
Rehmat	ke	āge	mujdah	sunāti	huyi	aur	
hamne	āsmān	se	pāni	utārā	pāk	karne	wālā

arabicText: لِّنُحْـِۧىَ بِهِۦ بَلْدَةًۭ مَّيْتًۭا وَنُسْقِيَهُۥ مِمَّا خَلَقْنَآ أَنْعَـٰمًۭا وَأَنَاسِىَّ كَثِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
In	order	that	We	may	revive	a	dead	city	
with	it,	and	give	it	to	the	many	beasts	and	
men	that	We	have	created,	to	drink.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tāke	ham	usse	zinda	kareiñ	kisi	murda	
shaher	ko	aur	usey		pilāyeiñ	apne	banāye	
huye		bahut	se	chaupāye	ādmiyoñ	ko

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَـٰهُ بَيْنَهُمْ لِيَذَّكَّرُوا۟ فَأَبَىٰٓ أَكْثَرُ ٱلنَّاسِ إِلَّا كُفُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	kept	cycles	of	water	among	
them	that	they	may	remember;	so	most	
men	did	not	accept,	except	to	be	
ungrateful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur		be-shak	ham	ne	un	meiñ	pāni	ke	phere	
rakhe	ke	woh	dhiyān	kareiñ	to	bahut	logoñ	
ne	na	mānā	magar	na-shukri	karnā

arabicText: وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَبَعَثْنَا فِى كُلِّ قَرْيَةٍۢ نَّذِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
If	We	willed,	We	could	have	sent	a	Herald	
of	Warning	to	every	village.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Ham	chāhte	to	har	basti	meiñ	ek	dar	sunāne	wālā	bhejte

arabicText: فَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ وَجَـٰهِدْهُم بِهِۦ جِهَادًۭا كَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText: So	do	not	listen	to	the	disbelievers	and,	with	this	Qur’an,	fight	a	great	war	against	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tu	kāfiroñ	kā	kahā	na	mān	aur	is	Qur’ān	se	unpar	Jihād	kar	badā	Jihād

arabicText: ۞ وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى مَرَجَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ هَـٰذَا عَذْبٌۭ فُرَاتٌۭ وَهَـٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌۭ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخًۭا وَحِجْرًۭا مَّحْجُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	caused	the	two	joint	seas	to	flow-	one	is	palatable,	very	sweet,	and	the	other	is	
salty,	very	bitter;	and	kept	a	veil	between	them	and	a	preventing	barrier.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	wohi	hai	jisne	mile	huye	rawāñ	kiye	do	samundar	yeh	meethā	hai	nihāyat	sheeriñ	aur	yeh	
khārā	hai	nihāyat	talkh	aur	unke	beech	meiñ	parda	rakhā	aur	ruki	huyi		āadh

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ مِنَ ٱلْمَآءِ بَشَرًۭا فَجَعَلَهُۥ نَسَبًۭا وَصِهْرًۭا ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ قَدِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	created	man	from	water,	then	appointed	relatives	and	in-laws	for	him;	and	your	
Lord	is	All	Able.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	wohi	hai	jisne	pāni	se	banāyā	āadmi	phir	uske	rishte	aur	sasurāl	muqarrar	ki	aur	tumhārā	
Rab	Qudrat	wālā	hai

arabicText: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُهُمْ وَلَا يَضُرُّهُمْ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱلْكَافِرُ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ ظَهِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	they	worship	such,	other	than	Allah,	which	neither	benefit	nor	hurt	them;	and	the	disbeliever	
helps	the	devil	instead	of	his	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allah	ke	siwā	aisoñ	ko	poojte	haiñ	jo	unkā	bhalā	burā	kuchh		na	kareiñ	aur	kāfir	apne	Rab	ke	
muqābil	shaitān	ko	madad	detā	hai

arabicText: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرًۭا وَنَذِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	not	sent	you	(O	dear	Prophet	
Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	except	as	a	Herald	of	glad	tidings	and	
warnings.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Hamne	tumheiñ	na	bhejā	magar	
khushi	aur	dar	sunātā

arabicText: قُلْ مَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِلَّا مَن شَآءَ أَن يَتَّخِذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“I	do	not	ask	any	fee	from	you	for	
this,	except	that	whoever	wills	may	take	
the	way	to	his	Lord.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	maiñ	uspar	tum	se	kuch		ujrat	
nahiñ	māñgtā	magar	jo	chāhe	ke	apne	Rab	
ki	taraf	rāh	leiñ

arabicText: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱلْحَىِّ ٱلَّذِى لَا يَمُوتُ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِهِۦ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِهِۦ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِۦ خَبِيرًا
englishTranslationText:
And	trust	the	Living	One	Who	will	never	
die,	and	praising	Him	proclaim	His	Purity;	
and	He	is	Sufficient	upon	the	sins	of	His	
bondmen,	All	Aware.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bharosa	karo	us	zinda	par	jo	kabhi	na	
maregā	aur	usey		sarāhte	huye		uski	pāki	
bolo	aur	wohi	kāfi	hai	apne	bandoñ	ke	
gunāhoñ	par	khabar-dār

arabicText: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍۢ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ ۚ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ فَسْـَٔلْ بِهِۦ خَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	One	Who	created	the	heavens	and	the	
earth	and	all	that	is	between	them	in	six	
days,	then	(befitting	His	Majesty)	
established	Himself	upon	the	Throne	(of	
control);	the	Most	Gracious	–	therefore	ask	
the	one	who	knows,	concerning	Him!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jisne	āasmān		aur	zameen	aur	jo	kuch	iske	
darmiyān	hai	chhe	(6)	din	meiñ	banāye	
phir	ársh	par	istawa	farmāyā	jaisā	uski	
shān	ke	lāyiq	hai	woh	badi	meher	
(Rahmat)	wālā,	tu	kisi	jānne	wāle	se	uski	
t’areef	pooñch

arabicText: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ قَالُوا۟ وَمَا ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ أَنَسْجُدُ لِمَا تَأْمُرُنَا وَزَادَهُمْ نُفُورًۭا ۩
englishTranslationText:
And	when	it	is	said	to	them,	“Prostrate	to	
the	Most	Gracious”	-	they	say,	“And	what	is	
the	Most	Gracious?	Shall	we	prostrate	to	
whatever	you	command	us?”	And	this	
command	only	increases	the	hatred	in	
them.	(Command	of	Prostration	#	7)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	unse	kahā	jāye	Rahmān	ko	Sajda	
karo	kahte		haiñ	Rahmān	kyā	hai?	Kyā	ham	
Sajda	kar	leiñ	jise	tum	kaho	aur	is	hukm	ne	
unheiñ	aur	bidaknā	badhāyā	
(Sajde	ka	hukm	#7)

arabicText: تَبَارَكَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ بُرُوجًۭا وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا سِرَٰجًۭا وَقَمَرًۭا مُّنِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Most	Auspicious	is	He	Who	created	lofty	
towers	in	the	sky	and	placed	a	lamp	in	it,	
and	the	luminous	moon.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Badi	barkat	wālā	hai	woh	jisne	āsmān		
meiñ	burj	banāye	aur	un	meiñ	chirāgh	
rakhā	aur	chamaktā	chāñd

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ خِلْفَةًۭ لِّمَنْ أَرَادَ أَن يَذَّكَّرَ أَوْ أَرَادَ شُكُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	created	the	alternation	of	the	night	and	day	for	one	who	wishes	to	remember	
or	intends	to	give	thanks.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	wohi	hai	jisne	rāt	aur	din	ki	badli	rakhi	uske	liye	jo	dhiyān	karnā	chāhe	yā	shukr	kā	irādah	
kare

arabicText: وَعِبَادُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلَّذِينَ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ هَوْنًۭا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ ٱلْجَـٰهِلُونَ قَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	the	bondmen	of	the	Most	Gracious	who	walk	upon	the	earth	humbly,	and	when	the	ignorant	
address	them	they	answer,	“Peace”.	(Good	–bye)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Rahmān	ke	woh		bande	ke	zameen	par	āahista	chalte	haiñ	aur	jab	jāhil	unse	bāt	karte	haiñ	to	
kahte	haiñ	bas	salām

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَبِيتُونَ لِرَبِّهِمْ سُجَّدًۭا وَقِيَـٰمًۭا
englishTranslationText: And	who	spend	the	night	prostrating	and	standing,	for	their	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	woh		jo	rāt	kāt	-te	haiñ	apne	Rab	ke	liye	Sajde	aur	Qiyām	meiñ

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا ٱصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا
englishTranslationText:
And	who	submit,	“Our	Lord	-	avert	the	punishment	of	hell	from	us;	indeed	its	punishment	is	a	
permanent	neck-shackle.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh		jo	árz		karte	haiñ	aey		hamāre	Rab	ham	se	pher	de	Jahannam	ka	áƶāb		be-shak	uska	ázāb		
gale	kā	gul	(phanda)	hai

arabicText: إِنَّهَا سَآءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّۭا وَمُقَامًۭا
englishTranslationText: Indeed	it	is	a	most	wretched	abode.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	woh		bahut	hi	buri	thaher	ne	ki	jagah	hai

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَآ أَنفَقُوا۟ لَمْ يُسْرِفُوا۟ وَلَمْ يَقْتُرُوا۟ وَكَانَ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ قَوَامًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who,	when	spending,	neither	exceed	the	limits	nor	act	miserly,	and	stay	in	moderation	
between	the	two.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh		ke	jab	kharch	karte	haiñ	na	hadse	badheiñ	aur	na	tangi	kareiñ	aur	in	donoñ	ke	beech	
e’etidāl	par	raheiñ

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَدْعُونَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ وَلَا يَقْتُلُونَ ٱلنَّفْسَ ٱلَّتِى حَرَّمَ ٱللَّهُ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَا يَزْنُونَ ۚ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ يَلْقَ أَثَامًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	do	not	worship	any	other	
deity	along	with	Allah,	and	do	not	unjustly	
kill	any	living	thing	which	Allah	has	
forbidden,	nor	commit	adultery;	and	
whoever	does	this	will	receive	
punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	Allah	ke	sāth	kisi	doosre	
m’ābood		ko	nahiñ	poojte	aur	us	jān	ko	jiski	
Allah	ne	hurmat	rakhi	na-haq	nahiñ	mārte	
aur	badkāri	nahiñ	karte	aur	jo	yeh	kām	
kare	woh	sazā	payegā

arabicText: يُضَـٰعَفْ لَهُ ٱلْعَذَابُ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وَيَخْلُدْ فِيهِۦ مُهَانًا
englishTranslationText:
The	punishment	shall	be	increased	for	him	
on	the	Day	of	Resurrection,	and	he	will	
remain	in	it	forever,	with	humiliation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Badhāyā	jāyegā	usper	áƶāb	Qayāmat	ke	din	
aur	hamesha	us	meiñ	zillat	se	rahegā

arabicText: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًۭا صَـٰلِحًۭا فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ ٱللَّهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمْ حَسَنَـٰتٍۢ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ غَفُورًۭا رَّحِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Except	one	who	repents	and	accepts	faith	
and	does	good	deeds	–	so	Allah	will	turn	
their	evil	deeds	into	virtues;	and	Allah	is	
Oft	Forgiving,	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	jo	tauba	kare	aur	Imān	lāye	aur	
achcha	kām	kare	to	aiso	ki	buraiyoñ	ko	
Allah	bhalāiyoñ	se	badal	degā	aur	Allah	
bakash	ne	wālā	maherbān		hai

arabicText: وَمَن تَابَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا فَإِنَّهُۥ يَتُوبُ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ مَتَابًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	whoever	repents	and	does	good	deeds	–	so	he	has	inclined	towards	Allah	with	
repentance	as	was	required.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	taubah	kare	aur	achcha	kām	kare	to	
woh	Allah	ki	taraf	ruju’	lāyā	jaisi	chāhiye	
thi.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَشْهَدُونَ ٱلزُّورَ وَإِذَا مَرُّوا۟ بِٱللَّغْوِ مَرُّوا۟ كِرَامًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	do	not	give	false	testimony,	
and	when	they	pass	near	some	indecency,	
they	pass	by	it	saving	their	honour.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	jhooti	gawāhi	nahiñ	dete	aur	jab	be
huda	par	guzarte	haiñ	apni	‘izzat	sambhāle	
guzar	jāte	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ يَخِرُّوا۟ عَلَيْهَا صُمًّۭا وَعُمْيَانًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who,	when	they	are	reminded	of	
the	signs	of	their	Lord,	do	not	fall	deaf	and	
blind	upon	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	ke	jabke	unheiñ	unke	Rab	ki	
Āayateiñ	yād	dilāyi	jāyeiñ	to	unpar	bahre	
andhe	hokar	nahiñ	girte

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَٰجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّـٰتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍۢ وَٱجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
englishTranslationText:
And	who	submit,	“Our	Lord,	soothe	our	
eyes	with	our	wives	and	our	children,	and	make	us	leaders	of	the	pious.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh		jo	árz		karte	haiñ	aey	hamāre	Rab	hameiñ	de	hamāri	bibiyoñ	aur	hamāri	aulād	se	āñkhoñ	
ki	thandak	aur	hameiñ	Parhezgāroñ	kā	peshwā	banā

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُجْزَوْنَ ٱلْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ وَيُلَقَّوْنَ فِيهَا تَحِيَّةًۭ وَسَلَـٰمًا
englishTranslationText:
They	will	be	rewarded	the	highest	position	in	heaven,	the	recompense	of	their	patience,	and	they	
will	be	welcomed	with	honour	and	greetings	of	peace.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unko	Jannat	kā	sabse	ooñchā	bālā	khānah	in’ām	milegā	badlah	unke	sabr	kā	aur	wahāñ	mujre	
(Du’a	wa	Adab)	aur	Salām	ke	sāth	unki	peshwāyi	hogi

arabicText: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّۭا وَمُقَامًۭا
englishTranslationText: They	shall	abide	in	it	forever;	what	an	excellent	abode	and	place	of	stay.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hamesha	us	meiñ	raheñge	kyā	hi	achchi	thaherne	aur	basne	ki	jagah

arabicText: قُلْ مَا يَعْبَؤُا۟ بِكُمْ رَبِّى لَوْلَا دُعَآؤُكُمْ ۖ فَقَدْ كَذَّبْتُمْ فَسَوْفَ يَكُونُ لِزَامًۢا
englishTranslationText:
Say	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	“You	have	no	value	before	My	
Lord	if	you	do	not	worship	Him;	so	you	have	denied	–	therefore	the	punishment	that	remains,	
will	occur.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	tumhāri	kuch	qadr	nahiñ	mere	Rab	ke	yahāñ	agar	tum	usey	na	poojo	to	tumne	to	
jhutlāyā	to	ab	hogā	woh	'aƶāb	ki	lipat	rahegā

arabicText: طسٓمٓ
englishTranslationText:
Ta-Seen-Meem*.	(*Alphabets of the Arabic 
language; Allah and to whomever He 
reveals, know their precise meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ta-Seen-Meem*.	
(*Arabi zabān k Huroof jinke Ma’āni Allah 
aur Jis par Allah Ta’āla ne Inko Nazil 
Farmaya Wahi Janta hai.)

arabicText: تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
englishTranslationText: These	are	verses	of	the	clear	Book
romanUrduTranslationText: Yeh 	Āyateiñ	haiñ	raushan	Kitāb	ki

arabicText: لَعَلَّكَ بَـٰخِعٌۭ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
If	We	will,	We	can	send	down	on	them	a	
sign	from	the	sky	so	that	their	leaders	
would	remain	bowed	before	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahiñ	tum	apni	jān	par	khel	jāoge	unke	
gham	meiñ	ke	woh	Imān	nahiñ	lāyeiñ

arabicText: إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةًۭ فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَـٰقُهُمْ لَهَا خَـٰضِعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	never	does	a	new	advice	come	to	them	
from	the	Most	Gracious,	but	they	turn	
away	from	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Agar	ham	chāheiñ	to	āsmān	se	unpar	koi	
nishāni	utāreiñ	ke	unke	ooñche	ooñche	
uske	huzoor	jhuke	rah	jāyeiñ

arabicText: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	they	have	denied,	so	now	soon	
coming	upon	them	are	the	tidings	of	what	
they	used	to	scoff	at.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	nahiñ	āati	unke	pās	Rahmān	ki	taraf	se	
koi	nayi	naseehat	magar	us	se	muñh	pher	
lete	haiñ

arabicText: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا۟ فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنۢبَـٰٓؤُا۟ مَا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Have	they	not	seen	the	earth,	that	how	
many	honourable	pairs	We	have	created	in	
it?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	be-shak	unhoñ	ne	jhutlāyā	to	ab	unpar	
āayā	chāhti	haiñ	khabreiñ	unke	tha-the 
(mazāQ)	ki

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍۢ كَرِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	this	is	a	sign;	and	most	of	them	
will	not	accept	faith.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	unhoñ	ne	zameen	ko	na	dekhā	hamne	
us	meiñ	kitne	izzat	wāle	jode	ugāye

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	this	is	a	sign;	and	most	of	them	
will	not	accept	faith.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	is	meiñ	zaroor	nishāni	hai	aur	
unke	aksar	imān	lāne	wāle	nahiñ

arabicText: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	your	Lord	–	indeed	only	He	is	
the	Almighty,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	tumhārā	Rab	zaroor	wohi	
izzat	wālā	maherbān		hai

arabicText: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئْتِ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	(remember)	when	your	Lord	said	to	
Moosa,	“Go	to	the	unjust	people.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	jab	tumhāre	Rab	ne	Mūsā		ko	
nidā	farmāyi	ke	ƶalim	logoñ	ke	pās	jā

arabicText: قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ أَلَا يَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText: “The	nation	of	Firaun;	will	they	not	fear?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	Fir’aun	ki	qaom	hai	kya	woh		na	dareñ	
ge

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“My	Lord,	I	fear	that	they	will	deny	
me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Árz		ki	aey		mere	Rab!	Maiñ	dartā	huñ	ke	woh	mujhe	jhutlāyeiñge	.

arabicText: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِى وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِى فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَـٰرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“I	feel	hesitant,	and	my	tongue	does	not	speak	
fast,	therefore	make	Haroon	also	a	Noble	
Messenger.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	merā	seenā	tangi	kartā	hai	aur	meri	zabān	nahiñ	chalti	to	tu	Hāroon	ko	bhi	Rasool	kar

arabicText: وَلَهُمْ عَلَىَّ ذَنۢبٌۭ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
englishTranslationText: “And	they	have	an	accusation	against	me,	so	I	fear	that	they	may	kill	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	unkā	mujh	par	ek	ilzām	hai	to	maiñ	dartā	huñ	kahiñ	mujhe	qatl	kardeiñ

arabicText: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَٱذْهَبَا بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“Not	like	this	(any	more);	both	of	you	go	with	Our	signs,	We	are	with	you,	All	Hearing.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Farmāyā	yuñ	nahiñ	tum	dono	meri	Āayateiñ	lekar	jāo	ham	tumhāre	sāth	sunte	haiñ

arabicText: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	approach	Firaun	then	proclaim,	‘We	both	are	Noble	Messengers	of	the	Lord	Of	The	
Creation.’
romanUrduTranslationText: To	fir’aun	ke	pās	jāo	phir	usse	kaho	ham	dono	uske	Rasool	haiñ	jo	Rab	hai	sāre	jahān	kā	.

arabicText: أَنْ أَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
englishTranslationText: ‘That	you	let	the	Descendants	of	Israel	go	with	us.’	”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	tu	hamāre	sāth	bani	Isrā’il	ko	chord	de

arabicText: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًۭا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Firaun,	“Did	we	do	not	raise	you	amongst	us,	as	a	child?	And	you	spent	many	years	of	your	
life	among	us!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bolā	kyā	hamne	tumheiñ	apne	yahāñ	bachpan	meiñ	na	pālā	aur	tumne	hamāre	yahāñ	apni	umr	
ke	kayi	baras	guzāre

arabicText: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِى فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText: “And	you	committed	the	deed	of	yours	that	you	committed,	and	you	were	ungrateful.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tumne	kiyā	apnā	woh	kām	jo	tumne	kiyā	aur	tum	nā-shukr	they

arabicText: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَآ إِذًۭا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Moosa,	“I	did	that	at	a	time	when	I	was	
unaware	of	the	consequences.”	(In	anger	-	
See	verse	28:15)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mūsā	ne	farmāyā:	Maine	woh	kām	kiyā		
jabke	mujhe	rāh	ki	khabar	na	thi

arabicText: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِى رَبِّى حُكْمًۭا وَجَعَلَنِى مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“I	therefore	went	away	from	you	as	I	
feared	you	–	so	my	Lord	commanded	me	
and	appointed	me	as	one	of	the	Noble	
Messengers.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	maiñ	tumhāre	yahāñ	se	nikal	gayā	jabke	
tumse	darā	to	mere	Rab	ne	mujhe	hukm	
áṭa	farmāyā	aur	mujhe	Paighambaroñ	se	
kiyā.

arabicText: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌۭ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَىَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	is	this	some	great	reward	for	which	
you	express	favour	upon	me	–	that	you	
have	enslaved	the	Descendants	of	Israel?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yeh	koi	n’emat	hai	jiskā	tu	mujh	par	
ehsān	jatātā	hai?	Ke	tune	gulām	banā	kar	
rakhe	bani	Isrā’il

arabicText: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَا رَبُّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Firaun,	“And	what	is	the	Lord	Of	The	
Creation?
romanUrduTranslationText: Fir’aun	bolā:	aur	sāre	jahān	kā	Rab	kyā	hai?

arabicText: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Moosa,	“Lord	of	the	heavens	and	the	
earth	and	all	that	is	between	them;	if	you	
believe.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mūsā	ne	farmāyā:	Rab	āasmānoñ	aur	
zameen	kā	aur	jo	kuch	inke	darmiyān	meiñ	
hai	agar	tumheiñ	yaqeen	ho

arabicText: قَالَ لِمَنْ حَوْلَهُۥٓ أَلَا تَسْتَمِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Firaun	to	those	around	him,	“Are	you	
not	listening	with	attention?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apne	āas-pās	wāloñ	se	bolā	kyā	tum	ghaur	
se	sunte	nahiñ?

arabicText: قَالَ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ ءَابَآئِكُمُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Moosa,	“Your	Lord	and	the	Lord	of	
your	forefathers	preceding	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mūsā	ne	farmāyā:	Rab	tumhārā	aur	
tumhāre	agle	bāp	dādāoñ	kā

arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Firaun,	“This	(Noble)	Messenger	of	
yours,	who	has	been	sent	towards	you,	has	
no	intelligence!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bolā	:	tumhāre	yeh	Rasool	jo	tumhāri	taraf 	
bheje	gaye	haiñ		zaroor	áql		nahiñ	rakhte

arabicText: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“The	Lord	of	the	East	and	the	West	
and	all	that	is	between	them;	if	you	have	
sense.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mūsā	ne	farmāyā:	Rab	purab	(Mashriq)	aur	
pachchhim	(Maghrib)	kā	aur	jo	kuch	unke	
darmiyān	hai	agar	tumheiñ	áql	ho?

arabicText: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذْتَ إِلَـٰهًا غَيْرِى لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمَسْجُونِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Firaun,	“If	you	ascribe	any	one	else	as	
a	God	other	than	me,	I	will	surely	imprison	
you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bolā:	agar	tumne	mere	siwā	kisi	aur	ko	
khudā	thahrāyā	to	maiñ	zaroor	tumheiñ	
Qaid	kar	duñgā

arabicText: قَالَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكَ بِشَىْءٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Moosa,	“Even	if	I	bring	to	you	
something	clear?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāyā:	kyā	agar-che	maiñ	tere	pās	koi	
raushan	cheez	lāoñ?

arabicText: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText: Said	Firaun,	“Then	bring	it,	if	you	are	of	the	truthful.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kahā:	to	lāo	agar	sachche	ho?

arabicText: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText: So	Moosa	put	down	his	staff	and	it	became	a	visible	serpent.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Mūsā	ne	apnā	ásā	dāl	diyā	jabhi	woh		
sareeh	azdahā	hogayā

arabicText: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	he	drew	forth	his	hand,	thereupon	it	shone	bright	before	the	beholders.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	apnā	hāth	nikālā	to	jabhi	woh	dekhne	wāloñ	ki	nigāh	meiñ	jagmagāne	lagā

arabicText: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسَـٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText: Said	Firaun	to	the	court	members	around	him,	“He	is	indeed	an	expert	magician.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bolā	apne	gird	ke	sardāroñ	se	ke	be-shak	yeh	dānā	jādugar	haiñ.

arabicText: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
englishTranslationText: “He	wishes	to	expel	you	out	of	your	land	by	his	magic;	so	what	is	your	advice?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Chāhte	haiñ	ke	tumheiñ	tumhāre	mulk	se	nikāl	deiñ	apne	jādu	ke	zor	se	tab	tumhārā	kyā	
mashwara	hai?

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبْعَثْ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَـٰشِرِينَ
englishTranslationText: They	said,	“Stop	him	and	his	brother,	and	send	gatherers	to	the	cities.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh		bole	unheiñ	aur	unke	bhāi	ko	thahrāye	raho	aur	shehroñ	meiñ	jam’ā	karne	wāle	bhejo

arabicText: يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحَّارٍ عَلِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText: “To	bring	to	you	every	expert	great	magician.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	woh		tere	pās	le	āyeiñ	har	bade	jādugar	dānā	ko

arabicText: فَجُمِعَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ لِمِيقَـٰتِ يَوْمٍۢ مَّعْلُومٍۢ
englishTranslationText: So	the	magicians	were	gathered	at	a	set	time	on	a	day	appointed.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	jam’ā	kiye	gaye	jādugar	ek	muqarrar	din	ke	w’ade	par

arabicText: وَقِيلَ لِلنَّاسِ هَلْ أَنتُم مُّجْتَمِعُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	it	was	said	to	the	people,	“Have	you	(also)	gathered?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	logoñ	se	kahā	gayā	kyā	tum	jam’ā	ho	gaye?

arabicText: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	people	said,	“Perhaps	we	may	follow	
the	magicians	if	they	are	victorious.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Shāyad	ham	in	jādugaroñ	hi	ki	pairwi	
kareiñ	agar	yeh	ghālib	āayeiñ

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا۟ لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	the	magicians	came,	they	said	to	
Firaun,	“Will	we	get	some	reward	if	we	are	
victorious?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	jādugar	āaye	fir’aun	se	bole	kyā	
hameiñ	kuchh		mazdoori	milegi?	Agar	ham	
ghālib	āaye?

arabicText: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًۭا لَّمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“Yes,	and	you	will	then	become	
close	to	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bolā	hāñ!	Aur	us	waqt	tum	mere	muqarrab	
ho	jāoge

arabicText: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلْقُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Moosa	said	to	them,	“Cast	whatever	you	
intend	to	cast.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mūsā	ne	unse	farmāyā:	Dālo	jo	tumheiñ	
dālnā	hai

arabicText: فَأَلْقَوْا۟ حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا۟ بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	they	threw	down	their	ropes	and	their	
staves	and	exclaimed,	“By	the	honour	of	
Firaun,	indeed	victory	is	ours!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unhoñ	ne	apni	rassiyāñ	aur	lāthiyāñ	
dāliñ	aur	bole	fir’aun	ki	izzat	ki	qasm	be
shak	hamāri	hi	jeet	hai

arabicText: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	Moosa	put	forth	his	staff	–	so	it	
immediately	began	swallowing	all	their	
fabrications.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Mūsā	ne	apnā	ásā	dālā	jabhi	woh		unki	
banāwatoñ	ko	nigalne	lagā

arabicText: فَأُلْقِىَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ سَـٰجِدِينَ
englishTranslationText: The	magicians	therefore	fell	down	prostrate.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ab	sajde	meiñ	gire	Jādugar.

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“We	have	accepted	faith	in	the	
Lord	Of	The	Creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole:	ham	Imān	lāye	uspar	jo	sāre	jahān	ka	
Rabhai

arabicText: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَـٰرُونَ
englishTranslationText: “The	Lord	of	Moosa	and	Haroon.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	Mūsā	aur	Hāroon	kā	Rab	hai.

arabicText: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمْ لَهُۥ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَـٰفٍۢ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Firaun,	“You	accepted	faith	in	him	
before	I	permitted	you!	He	is	indeed	your	
leader	who	taught	you	magic;	so	now	you	
will	come	to	know;	I	swear,	I	will	certainly	
cut	off	your	hands	and	your	feet	from	
alternate	sides,	and	crucify	all	of	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Fir’aun	bolā:	kyā	tum	us	par	Imān	lāye	qabl	
iske	ke	maiñ	tumheiñ	ijāzat	duñ	be-shak	
woh		tumhārā	badā	hai	jisne	tumheiñ	jādu	
sikhāyā	to	ab	jānā	chāhte	ho?	Mujhe	qasm	
hai	be-shak	maiñ	tumhāre	hāth	aur	doosri	
taraf	ke	pāoñ	kātuñgā	aur	tum	sabko	suli	
duñgā

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“No	harm	(in	it),	we	will	return	
to	our	Lord.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh		bole:	kuch	nuqsān	nahiñ	ham	apne	
Rab	ki	taraf	palatne	wāle	haiñ

arabicText: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَـٰيَـٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: “We	hope	that	our	Lord	will	forgive	us	our	mistakes,	as	we	are	the	first	to	believe.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hameiñ	tam’a	hai	ke	hamārā	Rab	hamāri	khatāyeiñ	bakhsh	de	ispar	ke	ham	sabse	pehle	Imān	
lāye

arabicText: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَـٰيَـٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: “We	hope	that	our	Lord	will	forgive	us	our	mistakes,	as	we	are	the	first	to	believe.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hameiñ	tam’a	hai	ke	hamārā	Rab	hamāri	khatāyeiñ	bakhsh	de	ispar	ke	ham	sabse	pehle	Imān	
lāye
